article.headline: Boston College 72, Sacred Heart 70
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Craig Smith scored eight of his 16 points in the closing 4:47 and Boston College escaped with a 72-70 win over Sacred Heart on Sunday afternoon. The Pioneers had two shots in the final six seconds. On the first, Uka Agbai blocked Omar Wellington's attempted 3-pointer, and the ball went out of bounds with 5.3 seconds left. Mike Queenan's turnaround baseline jumper bounced off the rim, and Smith grabbed the rebound as the horn sounded. Jared Dudley led BC (7-1) with 17 points and eight rebounds. Agbai scored 10 points and became the 30th player in Boston College history to reach 1,000 points. He now has 1,005. Boston College, which trailed 61-60 with just over five minutes left, grabbed the lead for good on Smith's short jumper with 4:18 left. Maurice Bailey led Sacred Heart with 27 points and became the 25th player in school history to reach 1,000 points. He now has 1,002. Wellington scored 14 for the Pioneers (3-4), who are 0-7 lifetime against the Big East. It was the first-ever meeting between the schools. BC, which was in a surprisingly close contest, appeared to break the game open with a 15-5 run over a 4:21 stretch early in the second half that pushed its lead to 54-37 with 13:10 left. But the Pioneers got back into the game by scoring 11 consecutive points, closing it to 57-52 on Bailey's free throw with 7:25 to play. They continued their run, scoring nine of the next 12 points to take a 61-60 lead on Wellington's fastbreak layup with 5:07 left. The Eagles, coming off a 67-57 loss at No. 12 St. Joseph's on Tuesday, led 33-27 at the half.
